data.title: Nice place, Great BBQ
data.text:
We went at about 7 or so on a Friday.  Tables were pretty much full but the bar seating was empty so the place looked pretty open.  Wife and I got the meat sampler that feeds 2-3 people.  Smoked sausage, pulled pork, Chicken Fingers, and ribs.  

Sausage was good, nice and smokey, with some heat left in it. Pulled pork was alright but once you put some House BBQ sauce on it, it was so much better.  The best part for me were the ribs and chicken fingers.  The ribs were huge and great with an awesome dry rub and a great smokey flavor.  The chicken fingers are infused with buttermilk so they have a very unique flavor profile.

When I get a chicken sandwich I put cheese and usually ketchup on them because, well, I'm a manchild, don't judge me.  But I could eat those chicken fingers all day, everyday, and do it with a smile.

data.title: Unique!!
data.text: We where in the mood for ribs, and found No Bull on trip advisor, decided to give it a try. We saw in the parking lot, they had outdoor seating, we headed to the back and it was really nice with outdoor heaters. Our server was great, she checked on us often and never made us feel forgotten! We got our drinks and cornbread very quick. When we walked through the restaurant and decided to eat outside, there did not seem to be too many people inside. It was app an hour before we got our food. The server was very apologetic, and took $10 off our bill. When we ordered, we all wanted ribs! At about 7pm on a Friday, they where out of ribs! We ordered other things of course, but it all just seemed OK!!! The decor was beautiful, really neat place! I would maybe call ahead next time and pre-order or make sure they have ribs!!!!! Our server was great!

data.title: Jay says
data.text: Interesting little place in old downtown Fargo. We went on a Saturday so there was a lot of Bison Fever around. Very nice waitress, quirky old style/modern décor, and loud. The menu had a lot of offerings, all barbecue variations.  I had the two meat platter as did our son. My wife had the one meat platter. We were unanimous in our evaluation. The presentation was pretty interesting and quirky, but the food was not so special. It was all okay, but when the waffles are the best part of the meal...It's probably worth a visit, but not so much a return visit.

data.title: Best BBQ ever in a restaurant!
data.text: My wife and I are KCBS competition judges, we travel a fair amount judging BBQ. It is very very rare to find BBQ ribs and pulled pork this good in a sit-down restaurant. Both meats had a great smoky flavor and were moist. If we were served these meats at a competition they would have scored very well. If the place is not too busy, and you have the interest, ask if the pit master has a few moments to talk about their work. He really enjoyed our talk, as did we.

data.title: The aroma of smoked meats will pull you I
data.text: I have walked near this business several times and wanted to visit.  Tried it for lunch today and was not disappointed.  We found a comfortable booth near the window to the street.  We were promptly waited on.  We just ordered water to drink and it was brought promptly with refills offered later.  I enjoyed a meal with two meats and two sides.  The sausage was good, not great and the pulled pork was also very good.  I enjoyed the beans with just the right amount of heat and flavor.  The creamy coleslaw was also very good.  Portions were generous and price presented a good value.  We were brought our check promptly and asked several times if we needed anything else.  Although it was a bit noisey I did enjoy the classic rock in the background.  Will stop by again.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised with my stop here. Stephanie was our server and was very pleasant. My sons drink cup was never empty so she pays attention to the customers. The food was very good and not badly priced for what you get.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: This place has a wonderful menu and the atmosphere was great. Loved the music video channel they had on, awesome 70's music!!😃 The pulled pork sandwich and fries had a great BBQ sauce. Huge portion of fries that I couldn't finish! Definitely want to go back. Great place to have drinks and a great meal. Must go to downtown, wonderful ambience.😃😃

data.title: Great place to eat.
data.text: Me and my wife went at 11am for lunch and the staff was nice and attentive, place smelled great and the service was awesome. We had the chicken finger platter and it tasted so good. Tater tots was a nice change from fries and tasted great. We will definitely come back.

data.title: Waited for food for over an hour
data.text:
We came to try this place with coworkers at half past noon in the middle of a week. The server was nice enough and brought drinks right away. However, he then didn't return to our table to take our order for 15 minutes. Finally we were able to order - the most basic items - pulled pork sandwiches, ribs, sausage. Half an hour later the waiter came and apologized that the food wasn't ready yet. Another 15 min later he came back and said they were out of ribs, so our friend had to substitute with pulled pork. 15 minutes later he said they were also out of sausage, so my friend had to substitute with chicken fingers. At this point people who came after us and were seated at the next table got their food, finished eating, paid and left. Finally an hour and 25 minutes later he brought our food and apologized that the delay was due to a company of 12 people who walked in after us. 
The food wasn't even that great. He did give us a discount of a few bucks per person to be fair.
As a result, we spent about 2 hours on a workday lunch at this place and will definitely not come back again.

data.title: Good Food, Fun Atmosphere, Great Service!
data.text: We stopped for a late lunch, so things were on the quiet side, however, the location is a great place to people watch. The server was attentive and ready with refills. The food looked as good as it tasted. You have to try the No Bull sauce. It was good on my sandwich and even better on my home cut fries. I could see where this would be a fun place to hang out in the evening, as they offer a full bar.

data.title: Hidden treasure in downtown Fargo
data.text: First discovered this place last year, and found they have the best chicken fingers around! They have extended their menu to have more bbq items since then as well. The atmosphere is unique and fun and the food and staff are awesome!

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: This is our first visit. We were extremely impressed with the food, service, the entire experience was wonderful!  I will be back soon and have recommended it to friends already!

data.title: Love the chicken menu
data.text: Something different in Fargo. The menu caters to those who love chicken. Try the chicken ala poutine!! Delicious!!

data.title: A Wonderful Discovery in Downtown Fargo!
data.text:
This spot caught the corner of my eye as I drove by on Broadway.  They've been open coming onto a year.  When I arrived (around 5 PM), it was about 1/4 to 1/3 full.  The service was great and I decided to try the sampler platter. ($29 - serves 2 - 3 people).  Although the menu is pick and choose, I wanted the convenience of just getting a taste of everything without the piecemeal ordering system!  I knew there would be at least two meals for me and that was just fine!  

Everything meaty was terrific, I had chicken fingers, pulled pork, sausage links, pork ribs on-the-bone.  I had sides of baked beans and french fries and got a corn muffin.  The sides were where I had a few comments.  Baked beans with pork pieces were overly spicy hot.  The "heat" overpowered the taste, unfortunately. What a shame!

I swapped the included Cole slaw for the fries (pay up the difference), and when they arrived, I knew I made a mistake.  The bowl of fries was wa-a-a-y too big for me, and a bit cool when served.

Next time, I'm going to take the extra time and effort to order precisely what I want...and no more!  It's so good, and you can easily fall into the trap of overdoing it!

This place is a great addition to downtown and to Fargo! It's worth the drive to get there from the 'burbs if you're staying on the 13th Ave strip area.

My only suggestion would be for the mgmt to come up with a balanced plate for one rather than a platter to share!  Currently this is BBQ served in a bar, but I hope it becomes a BBQ restaurant that serves alcohol!  They would attract more visitors and Fargo hasn't had a great BBQ  place for years since a family operation in the Westgate Strip Mall shut down too long ago.

data.title: Expanded menu
data.text: On my last visit they had expanded the menu. Still no beef, but now they have a variety of pork items -- ribs, sausage, pulled pork -- as well as chicken. All are good but for me the chicken is still the best thing on the menu. It is really good -- tender and moist -- and we will keep going back for that. the space was also expanded.

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text: Went with family and had their family style platters for 3-4. Plenty of food for 5 of us. Callie was a great waitress and the food was terrific. Great downtown location. Clean restrooms. Great blues music.

data.title: Absolutely No Bull
data.text:
Just like the name says... everything and anything but beef.

The second you walk in, you can smell the BBQ smoke.  As soon as you sit down, you will be greeted with their 3 home made sauces.  Original, Honey Mustard and Spicy.

Staff is outstanding and very helpful.  According to our server, everything is made in house and everything is fresh.  Staff start cooking at 9AM just to be ready for service to start at 4PM.

We ordered the Picture Perfect Platter so we could try everything for this review.

Not sure where to start.  So many great items.  The ribs have an amazing smoke ring that goes deep into the ribs.  The dry rub is wonderful and the meat falls off the bones.  Chicken has a batter that is extremely light and very tasty.  Sausage is smoked wonderfully and cut just perfectly.  

You'll have to ask for it, but try their mac and cheese.  Of course, just like everything else, it's made from scratch upstairs.  Served with sausage links and SO GOOD.

Good amount of beer on tap.  Several custom drinks.  Bartender makes drinks quickly and service is immediate.

Parking is of course not easy (never is downtown)  and currently a large section of NP Ave is torn up.  No matter where you park, it's worth the walk.

data.title: The BEST chicken fingers I have ever had!
data.text: Hope you like chicken because that's what they have.  Eat chicken fingers here and you will never order them any where else again!  Their No Bull Sauce has a bit of a kick and compliments the fingers well.  The toast is crunchy and soft, not hard and stale.  Treat yourself to some great chicken at great prices.

data.title: Not just a bar
data.text:
My wife and I ate here for lunch one day.  She really liked the atmosphere and the food was good too.  She ordered the chicken strips with fries and I ordered the chicken bacon ranch sandwich.  Service was good and the staff was helpful.
As the name says, they don't serve anything beef, but you can find bacon on some things.

We had seen the place before, but had written it off as a night club only.  It was definitely nice to find another downtown place to eat lunch at.
